mvp.core

Interface PropertyChangeView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractListenerView

    @NotThreadSafe
public interface PropertyChangeView
    A basic interface for a simple API for making GUI classes that can be updated abstractly in a Model-View-Presenter design pattern. Its single method, changeProperty(PropertyChangeEvent), allows any controller looking to update it to pass PropertyChangeEvents to the class via this interface using dependency inversion. The GUI class then handles the event without the controller needing any knowledge of the view's implementation. The PropertyChangeEvent passed to the method can be acted on or ignored, depending on the event's attributes.

    Property name values should be constants stored in a single class. This ensures consistency and avoids errors.

    NOTE: All views implementing this interface should be added to the appropriate controller prior to the GUI being displayed.

    THREAD SAFETY: Swing is NOT thread safe. All methods in this class MUST be invoked on the EventDispatchThread.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Craig
    See Also:
    AbstractPropertyModel, AbstractController

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeProperty(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent event)
      Passes a PropertyChangeEvent to this view to update a property being displayed in the GUI.

    • Method Detail

      • changeProperty

        void changeProperty(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent event)
        Passes a PropertyChangeEvent to this view to update a property being displayed in the GUI. Implementations of this method should use conditional logic to test the property name to see if it applies to this view and what action to take. If the property passed to this view does not apply to it, simple ignore the event.
        Parameters:
        event - the PropertyChangeEvent being passed to this view.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the newValue parameter of the event is not a value type that the view is expecting to receive for that particular property.
